KeysToMetaData.DemoNoFeature: This feature is <Text.Red>NOT</> available in the <Text.Cyan>Demo</> version of the game.
KeysToMetaData.TipChangeKeyBinds: Open a menu that allows customising key inputs. If not using the mouse and keyboard input platform then this will open the gamepad layout selector.
KeysToMetaData.TipChangeGamepayLayout: Open a menu to select different button layouts for your controller.
KeysToMetaData.TipFriendUseCode: Your friends can enter this code by pressing the Join Friend button on the main menu under Play > Online.
KeysToMetaData.TipFriendGiveCode: Give the Friend Code (<Text.Orange>{Code}</>) to your friends so they can join your game.
KeysToMetaData.TipFriendHostCode: Have your friend Host an Online server to find the Friend Code on their Lobby screen.
KeysToMetaData.TipFriendEnterCode: Get the Friend Code from your friend and enter it here to join their game.
KeysToMetaData.CreditsSecret: A new secret head has been unlocked!
KeysToMetaData.CreditsSecretAward: Congratulations, you’ve watched to the end of the credits!
KeysToMetaData.DialogBanPlayer:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>BAN</> <Text.Yellow>{Name}</> from your games?

They can only be unbanned by manually editing your ban list in: <Text.Orange>Unboxed/Saved/Config/GameUserSettings.ini</>
KeysToMetaData.DialogBindPressKey: Press a key to bind to <Text.Cyan>{Action}</>
KeysToMetaData.DialogBindReplaceKey:
<Text.Orange>{Key}</> is already bound to <Text.Orange>{Action}</>.

Do you want to clear and replace that action?
KeysToMetaData.DialogGuestAccountCopy:
Please note that this player is a <Text.Orange>Guest</> and will <Text.Red>NOT</> be able to Load or Save any of their progression.

Would you like this player to start with the unlockables from the primary user account?
KeysToMetaData.DialogDisconnect: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Disconnect</> and return to the menu?
KeysToMetaData.DialogKeepSettings: Do you want to keep these new settings?
KeysToMetaData.DialogNoServers: Failed to find any matching servers...
KeysToMetaData.DialogQuit: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Quit</> HYPERCHARGE: Unboxed?
KeysToMetaData.DialogResetBinds: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Reset your controls</> to default?
KeysToMetaData.DialogResetVideo: Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Reset video settings</> to default?
KeysToMetaData.DialogReturnToLobby:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Return to the lobby</>?

The current game will end and all progress will be lost.
KeysToMetaData.DialogReturnToMenu:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>Return to the main menu</>?

The current game will end and all progress will be lost.
KeysToMetaData.DialogEndGame:
Are you sure you want to <Text.Red>End the current game</>?

Any progress or stats from the current round will be lost.
KeysToMetaData.DialogSaveApply: Do you want to <Text.Green>Save and apply</> the new Settings?
KeysToMetaData.DialogTutorial:
Do you want to play the tutorial level?

<Text.Grey>This is recommended for players new to the game.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorCloudSave: Failed to save files to cloud...
KeysToMetaData.ErrorConnectionTimeOut: Connection to the server timed out...
KeysToMetaData.ErrorJoinFailed: Failed to connect to the server...
KeysToMetaData.ErrorNetChecksum:
Checksum mismatch.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorNoFriendsPlaying: Failed to find any friends playing HYPERCHARGE
KeysToMetaData.ErrorNoMap:
No level found.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorOutdatedClient:
Client is outdated.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorOutdatedServer:
Server is outdated.

<Text.Orange>Please try joining a server that matches your version.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorPackageMissing:
Package is missing.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorPackageVersion:
Package version mismatch.

<Text.Orange>Please check that your game is up to date.</>
KeysToMetaData.ErrorPendingNetGame: Failed to create pending net game.
KeysToMetaData.ErrorStartOnlineSession: Failed to start online session. Please check your internet connection.
KeysToMetaData.ErrorTravelFailure: Failed to travel to new level.
KeysToMetaData.ErrorFriendsFirewall: If this is your Friends server, make sure they have an exception in their Firewall for the game.
KeysToMetaData.ErrorFindServers: Try using the Find Servers menu to manually join a different game.
KeysToMetaData.ErrorSessionClosed: The host has closed down the session.
KeysToMetaData.FindServerCreateLobby:
<Text.Orange>Failed to find any matching servers.</>

Would you like to create your own Lobby with the current settings?
KeysToMetaData.FoundServerMatchmaking:
<Text.Green>Found matching session '{Session}' on '{Map}' ({Difficulty})</>

Do you want to join this server?
KeysToMetaData.FoundServerUnmatched:
<Text.Green>Failed to find exact matching session.</>

Do you want to join the session '{Session}' on '{Map}' ({Difficulty}), instead?
KeysToMetaData.HelpAndSupportTip: <Text.Grey>Scan this QR Code using your</> <Text.Orange>Smart Phone</> <Text.Grey>to visit our Support Forum</>
KeysToMetaData.SelectNameElement: Select a new Name Element from the list above.
KeysToMetaData.ThankYouDevelopment:
HYPERCHARGE: Unboxed has been in development for over 5 years.








Thank you to all of our fans who supported us in Early Access
KeysToMetaData.ThankYouForPlaying: Thank you for playing our game!
KeysToMetaData.TipAmbientOcclusion: Do you want to enable or disable ambient occlusion? This adds shading and depth to the world but can have strange artifacts on edges.
KeysToMetaData.TipAnisotropicQuality:
Select the strength of the texture filtering used when rendering textures on an angle. This is easiest to see when looking at a flat surface in the distance.

<Text.Grey>Off</> = Blurry (Maximum Performance)
<Text.Perf1>2x</> = Slightly Sharper (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>4x</> = Sharper (Good Quality, Good Performance)
<Text.Perf3>8x</> = Even Sharper (High Quality, Lower Performance)
<Text.Perf4>16x</> = Sharpest (Highest Quality, Lowest Performance)
KeysToMetaData.TipAntiAliasing:
Choose which method is used to help clean up jagged or pixelated edges on the screen.

<Text.Perf1>Off</> = Jagged Edges (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>FXAA</> = Blurry Smooth Edges (High Performance)
<Text.Perf3>TXAA*</> = Smoother Edges (High Quality, Lower Performance)
<Text.Perf4>TXAA-HQ*</> = Smoothest Edges (Highest Quality, Lowest Performance)

<Text.Grey>* May suffer from Ghosting Artifacts.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipApplySettings: Apply any changes to the display settings to the game. Please wait until you see the conformation dialog to ensure that any settings have applied correctly.
KeysToMetaData.TipBanPlayer: Do you want to <Text.Red>ban</> <Text.Yellow>{Name}</> from your games?
KeysToMetaData.TipCapturePreview:
Exports a snapshot screenshot (with an Alpha channel) of your character.

Screenshots will be stored in your Unboxed/Unboxed/Screenshots folder.
KeysToMetaData.TipChangeBackground:
Cycle the current background colour.

The chosen background colour will be saved.
KeysToMetaData.TipChangeMusic:
Cycle the music to the next track.

There are 5 tracks.
KeysToMetaData.TipChangeWeapons: Change the current preview weapon that the player is holding.
KeysToMetaData.TipGenerateRandomCharacter: Generate an entire random character set using all of the currently unlocked heads, skins, materials, names and buildables.
KeysToMetaData.TipDepthOfField:
Do you want to enable or disable the depth of field (distance blur effect) in the levels?

Depth of Field adds a sense of scale to the world, but is not a cheap effect. This can be disabled from the Post Processing Quality setting.
KeysToMetaData.TipDisplayDamageFlash: Do you want to see the flash effect when enemies are damaged?
KeysToMetaData.TipDisplayGamma:
Set the Gamma of the current Display.

Useful for brightening the screen during daytime, or to help with overall brightness when using a HDR display.
KeysToMetaData.TipDisplayHealthbars: Do you want to draw health bars over enemies, buildables and players?
KeysToMetaData.TipEffectsQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the Visual Effects in the game. This affects the quality of shaders, reflections, refraction, plastics and particles.

<Text.Perf1>Low*</> Quality FX (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium*</> Quality FX (High Performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Quality FX (High Quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Quality FX (Highest Quality)

<Text.Grey>* Reflections and other advanced rendering FX disabled.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipFieldOfView:
Change the Field of View of the camera.

A good value for most people is around 90. Consoles running on a TV should use a lower FOV and people with wider or multi-monitor setups may want to use larger value.
KeysToMetaData.TipFieldOfViewFP:
Adjust the Field of View of the First-Person Weapon and Arms.

This is a cosmetic change for those who feel the weapon is too large or too small for their screen or current main FOV.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterTeamPlay: Only search for games that are playing a Team-based multiplayer mode.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterFriendsOnly: Only search for games that are hosted by players on your Friends list.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterGameMode: Only search for servers that are playing the currently selected Game Mode.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterGameType: Only search for games that are playing this game type. Cooperative or Multiplayer.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterMapList: Only search for games that are playing one or more of the currently selected Maps.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterServerLAN: Only search the local network for games. If disabled online games will be found.
KeysToMetaData.TipFilterServerLocal: Only search nearby devices for games. Only players hosting a Local Play game will be found. If disabled, online games will be found.
KeysToMetaData.TipFindGame: Search for a server that matches the current filter settings. If a server cannot be found, your will be prompted to start an online lobby for other players to join.
KeysToMetaData.TipFoliageQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the foliage. This changes the density of grass and other smaller mass-rendered detail objects on levels.

<Text.Perf1>Low</> Most reduced foliage (Highest Performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium</> Half reduced foliage (High Performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Slightly reduced foliage (High Quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Standard foliage count (Highest Quality)
KeysToMetaData.TipFrameRateLimit:
Select the limit that you would like to apply to the frame rate in the game.

This can be used to lower the FPS on less powerful computers, or to lift the usual limits when using a high refresh rate monitor.
KeysToMetaData.TipFriendsOnly: Do you want to host a game that only allows people on your friends list to join?
KeysToMetaData.TipGameMode: Select the overall game mode that defines the rules of the game. Different game modes are limited to different game types.
KeysToMetaData.TipGameModeWV:
<Text.Orange>Waves</>:
Protect the HYPERCOREs from enemy toys! Build defences, collect resources and explore the world of HYPERCHARGE. Team up with friends to help complete harder difficulties with more enemies!
KeysToMetaData.TipGameModeFR:
<Text.Orange>Free-Roam</>:
Explore the world to learn the best routes and find secret collectibles in your own time or master those jumps!
KeysToMetaData.TipGameModePvP:
<Text.Orange>Deathmatch</>:
Fight against other players in this Player vs Player mode! Team up and customise the Game Rules for some exciting and fresh gameplay!
KeysToMetaData.TipGameModePL:
<Text.Orange>Plague</>:
How long can you survive? Ammo is limited, the infected only need to touch you and it’s over... Can you climb, run and work together to survive the longest?
KeysToMetaData.TipGameModeTB:
<Text.Orange>Tank Battle</>:
Tank vs Tank combat in the garden. Can you secure your own corner of the battlefield or will your friends outflank you?
KeysToMetaData.TipGameModeSA:
<Text.Orange>Spinner Arena</>:
Jump, dash and smash your way to victory upon the airhockey table. Which Spinner will survive this free for all frenzy?
KeysToMetaData.TipPartyGameJoyCons: <Text.Grey>Single Joy-Con™ per player and supports up to 4 players.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipGameRules: Customise the game rules to spice up your current match! This also allows changing various host options that might be useful.
KeysToMetaData.TipGameType: Do you want to play a co-operative or multiplayer game mode?
KeysToMetaData.TipGenerateName: Try your luck and generate a random name out of your unlocked name combinations!
KeysToMetaData.TipHideHUD:
Do you want to hide the main Heads Up Display?

This can useful for screenshots.
KeysToMetaData.TipHideRadar: Do you want to hide the Radar weapon attachment and display the on-screen Radar instead?
KeysToMetaData.TipHostType: Do you want to host an online or local game? Online will allow friends over the internet to play together, local will allow nearby devices to connect and play together.
KeysToMetaData.TipInputPlatform:
Change the input platform for the game to match your preferred controller input.

Some platforms will adjust the default menu control that are displayed. For example Playstation controls will use Triangle for 'Back' commands.
KeysToMetaData.TipJoinServer: Connect to the currently selected game.
KeysToMetaData.TipKickPlayer: Do you want to <Text.Red>remove</> <Text.Yellow>{Name}</> from the game?
KeysToMetaData.TipMapSelection: View and edit the current list of maps. This will also display your current level progress and awards if you’re playing the <Text.Orange>Co-operative</> game mode.
KeysToMetaData.TipMatchmaking: Use online matchmaking to automatically set you up in an online match. If a matching game cannot be found a new one will be created with your current settings.
KeysToMetaData.TipFindMatchmaking: View and edit settings for the matchmaking system to find an online match automatically.
KeysToMetaData.TipFindServers: View a list of active servers, filter the list, and then select a game to join.
KeysToMetaData.TipMaxPlayers: Select the maximum number of players allowed in this match.
KeysToMetaData.TipMoreInformation:
Hold down the more information key to bring up this window. This will can help you understand what a specific menu option does.

This can also be used to find out information about how to unlock a new head, or to find the current stats of a level.
KeysToMetaData.TipMotionBlur: We try not to use this effect too much as we don't like it being applied excessively but disabling it entirely can gain some extra performance.
KeysToMetaData.TipOffsetGamepad: This can be used to allow the first player to play using Keyboard and Mouse with the Gamepads being used for other players.
KeysToMetaData.TipPostProcesQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the post processing effects in the game. These are mostly just cosmetic full-screen FX. These affect the overall quality of ambient occlusion, depth of field, lens flares, the tonemapper, and blur.

<Text.Perf1>Low*</> Quality, most FX disabled (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium*</> Quality, some FX disabled (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Quality, no FX disabled (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Quality, no FX disabled (Highest quality)

<Text.Grey>* Reflections, background blur and other advanced rendering FX may be disabled.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipRealtimeReflections:
Do you want to enable or disable realtime reflections on any mirror or water surfaces?

This can be performance intensive and negatively impact framerates on maps that use it heavily.

This feature is disabled when playing split screen.
KeysToMetaData.TipRefreshList: Clear the games list and use the current settings to try and find games that you can join.
KeysToMetaData.TipRenderThreadDelay: Disabling the render thread delay can result in removing one frame of latency on inputs, but can result in potential frame drops if your computer is not able to run the game at the maximum frame rate.
KeysToMetaData.TipResolution:
Select the resolution of the display window.

<Text.Orange>This should match the resolution of your desktop.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipResolutionScale:
Set the resolution scale of the internal renderer.

<Text.Orange>This is preferable to changing the resolution if you wish to gain performance.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleCameraShake: Adjusts how much the camera shakes. Lowering this can help with motion sickness.
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleHUD:
The scale of the heads up display.

This will help increase or decrease the size of the in-game HUD to better suit the distance your are from the screen or for general readability.
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleNightMode: Increasing this value will tint and darken the screen to help with playing in low-light environments.
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleUI: Adjusts the overall scale of the user interface in the game and can help with text readability.
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleCrosshair: Adjusts the overall size of the aiming crosshair in the center of the screen.
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleVibration: Adjusts the overall strength of controller vibration.
KeysToMetaData.TipScaleWeaponSway: Adjusts how much the weapon will shift around when moving and turning. This cosmetic change is for people who prefer to use the first Person weapon as an anchor point and can help alleviate motion sickness at lower values.
KeysToMetaData.TipScreenMode:
Set the screen mode of the display window.

Windowed = Run in a window
Fullscreen = Run in exclusive fullscreen
Fullscreen Borderless = Run in a fullscreen window
KeysToMetaData.TipSelectLanguage: Change the current language and locale.
KeysToMetaData.TipShadowQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the shadows in the game.

<Text.Perf1>Low*</> Shadow resolution (0.25x) (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium*</> Shadow resolution (0.5x) (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Shadow resolution (1x) (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Shadow resolution (2x) (Highest quality)


<Text.Grey>* Volumetric lighting and other advanced lighting FX disabled.</>
KeysToMetaData.TipShowFPS:
Do you want to display the frames per second counter on the right hand side of the screen?

This is useful for helping pick what video options are best for your computer.
KeysToMetaData.TipSplitScreen2: Select how the screen is split when playing with only 2 players.
KeysToMetaData.TipSplitScreen3: Select how the screen is split when playing with 3 players.
KeysToMetaData.TipSplitScreenQuality:
Use this to offset and lower the current video settings while playing in split screen.

Split screen is very demanding, and this feature will allow you to lower the video settings without affecting your current saved settings.
KeysToMetaData.TipStartGame: Start a game with the currently selected settings.
KeysToMetaData.TipStartGameSingleplayer: Start a singleplayer game with the currently selected settings.
KeysToMetaData.TipStartGameSplitscreen: Start a split-screen game with the currently selected settings.
KeysToMetaData.TipControllerMenu: Change order of your connected controllers.
KeysToMetaData.TipCheatMenu: Enter or enable your <Text.Purple>Cheats</> in this menu.
KeysToMetaData.TipStartGameParty: Start a <Text.Orange>Local multiplayer</> Party Game with friends using the currently selected settings.
KeysToMetaData.TipPlayersMenu: List the current players in game.
KeysToMetaData.TipCustomiseMenu: Customise your character and find out how to unlock new skins, heads, buildables, and names!
KeysToMetaData.TipCreditsMenu:
Who are the people behind the game?

<Text.Grey>There may also be a secret hidden somewhere in the credits!</>
KeysToMetaData.TipTextureQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the textures in the game. This mostly affects the amount of streaming data the engine is allowed to load during runtime.

<Text.Perf1>Low</> Memory (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Medium</> Memory (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>High</> Memory (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Max</> Memory (Highest quality)
KeysToMetaData.TipToggleLighting: Toggle lighting on the character preview to better see emissive details.
KeysToMetaData.TipUsePushToTalk: Do you want to use a bound input to choose when your voice should be transmitted to other players?
KeysToMetaData.TipUseVoiceChat: Do you want to use voice chat to be able to communicate with other players using a microphone?
KeysToMetaData.TipVerticalSync:
Set enabled to help remove the effects of screen tearing by locking the frame rate. Screen tearing can occur when the game runs at rate that doesn't match your monitor.

Enabling V-Sync may result in input latency.

V-Sync is not needed if you have a G-Sync monitor. 

Some graphics drivers allow overriding the V-Sync option in some games if the internal solution is too aggressive.
KeysToMetaData.TipViewQuality:
Choose the quality setting of the view distance in the game. Some props in the distance map 'pop' out of existence. This also changes how early high detail models are loaded in.

<Text.Perf1>Halved</> View distance (Highest performance)
<Text.Perf2>Reduced</> View distance (High performance)
<Text.Perf3>Default</> View distance (High quality)
<Text.Perf4>Extended</> View distance (Highest quality)
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumeAnnouncer: Adjust the volume of Max Ammo’s voice.
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumeGame: Adjust the volume of the game and user interface without affecting the volume of the music.
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumeMaster: Adjust the volume of the overall game and all of the sound effects.
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumeMusic: Adjust the volume of the music without affecting the volume of the game and user interface.
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumetricLighting:
Do you want to enable or disable volumetric lighting?

Volumetic lighting is a performance intensive effect and disabling it can help less powerful computers without impacting the overall visual fidelity of the game.
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumeVoice: Adjust the volume of other players’ voice communication.
KeysToMetaData.TipVolumeVoiceTransmit: Adjust the volume of your own voice chat when it is transmitted to other players.
KeysToMetaData.TipGyroAiming: Enable use of the Gyroscope to aid in turning the player.
KeysToMetaData.TipGyroInvert: Invert the vertical direction of the Gyroscope.
KeysToMetaData.TipGyroSensitivity: Adjust the sensitivity of the Gyroscope.
KeysToMetaData.TipGyroAlways: Enable the Gyroscope to be active at all times instead of only while aiming.
KeysToMetaData.TipGyroSensitivityBoost: Boost the speed of the Gyroscope while aiming.
KeysToMetaData.TipGyroLockMode: Optionally use specific direction of movement from the Gyroscope by locking veritcal or horizontal movement.
KeysToMetaData.TipMouseSensitivity: Adjust the sensitivity of the mouse movement.
KeysToMetaData.TipMouseSmoothing: Mouse smoothing adjusts the input of the mouse to smooth out the movement when making small increments. This is only recommended when using extremely low DPI mice.
KeysToMetaData.TipMouseInvert: Invert the vertical direction of the mouse movement.
KeysToMetaData.TipEditController: Change which controller is being edited with the settings below.
KeysToMetaData.TipGamepadAcceleration: Enable if you want to enable acceleration while turning the player.
KeysToMetaData.TipGamepadAccelerationRate: Adjust the rate of the acceleration curve while turning the player. Higher values results in faster acceleration.
KeysToMetaData.TipGamepadInvert: Invert the direction of looking vertically.
KeysToMetaData.TipGamepadSensitivity: Adjust the turn speed of the player.
KeysToMetaData.TipVoiceMenuInput: Change which Gamepad thumbstick controls the input for the voice command radial menu.
KeysToMetaData.TipToggleSprint: When enabled pressing the sprint button will toggle sprinting of the player instead of having the hold down the sprint key.
KeysToMetaData.TipToggleAiming: When enabled pressing the aim button will toggle aiming instead of having to hold down the aim key.
KeysToMetaData.TipStatsPage:
Come back here to check your progression in the world of <Text.Yellow>HYPERCHARGE</>.

Complete levels, destroy enemies, find secrets and collectibles, and see what awards you have unlocked!
